description:
Joined by guitarist Peter Rom, bassist Hanibal Scheutz, and long-time
collaborator Sixtus Preiss on drums and arrangements, her band delivers
intimate, dynamic performances that move fluidly between reflection,
celebration, laughter, and quiet intensity. From her beginnings as a singing
DJ and philosophy student to four albums, collaborations, teaching, and essays
on motherhood and art, Parisini’s work resonates deeply with jazz lovers and
thoughtful listeners alike.

address.streetAddress: Windmills Craftworks, Raheja Commerzone, Knowledge City, Rai Durg, Hyderabad - 500032Hyderabad

name: Windmills Music Night - Violetta Parisini Band-Hyd

performer.description: Violetta Parisini creates songs that open emotional landscapes listeners instantly recognize, even when they can’t quite name them. Singing in English and German, she weaves vulnerability, joy, grief, and tenderness—often holding contradictions side by side. Her songwriting transcends language, ensuring emotional clarity for non-German-speaking audiences.
performer.name: Violetta Parisini Band

description:
Hailed by A.R. Rahman as a “living hope for quality music,” Prasanna brings to
the stage a powerful set drawn from his vast body of work. Expect a high-
energy musical journey through his signature sound — Ragabop, a thrilling
blend where Indian classical ragas meet the spontaneity and sophistication of
Jazz.

address.streetAddress: Windmills Craftworks, Raheja Commerzone, Knowledge City, Rai Durg, Hyderabad - 500032Hyderabad

name: Windmills Music Night - RAGABOP – The Intersection Of Indian Music And Jazz-Hyd

performer.description: Get ready for an unforgettable night with Guitar Prasanna — one of India’s most celebrated and globally acclaimed guitar virtuosos and composers. Described by AllAboutJazz as an artist who “plays like nobody on the planet” and praised by guitar legend Guthrie Govan for making the electric guitar do the impossible, Prasanna’s music is truly in a league of its own.
performer.name: RAGABOP – The Intersection Of Indian Music And Jazz

description:
Blending Electronic Folk (Folktronica) with Kannada and Hindi songwriting,
their sound is both contemporary and deeply connected to cultural roots. The
Collective also features powerful renditions of poetry by saint poets such as
Purandaradasa, Basavanna, and Kabir, along with works by modern lyricists and
writers—adding depth and fresh perspective to every performance. An extension
of Vasu’s artistic journey, VDC embodies his soulful vocals, wide range, and
vibrant energy in a moving celebration of life.
name: Windmills Music Night - Vasu Dixit Collective

performer.description: Vasu Dixit Collective (VDC) is an ensemble of like-minded musicians and artists whose collaboration brings together musicianship, creativity, and tradition into an immersive live experience. Rooted in community and compassion, VDC creates music that is meant to be felt, shared, and celebrated together.
performer.name: Vasu Dixit Collective

description:
Tomasz Bura, a Poland-born London-based jazz pianist, composer and bandleader,
is a key voice on the European jazz scene, known for his acclaimed albums
Ritual and The Room Upstairs and performances at iconic stages such as Ronnie
Scott’s. Together, they deliver an immersive set that bridges classical
elegance, jazz freedom, and contemporary expression.
name: Windmills Music Night - A Night Of Gershwin & Hollywood Classics

performer.description: LOLA G is a Moscow-born soprano and recording artist celebrated for her ability to move effortlessly between classical, jazz and contemporary worlds. Trained at the Purcell School, Guildhall School of Music & Drama and the Royal Academy of Music, she has performed internationally at prestigious venues and festivals.
performer.name: A Night Of Gershwin & Hollywood Classics

description:
Formed in the late 1990s, the band gained international attention with their
acclaimed debut Bahamut, praised for its adventurous fusion of styles and
featured on major broadcasts such as NPR’s All Things Considered. Over the
years, Hazmat Modine has continued to evolve through bold collaborations and
energetic live performances, releasing standout records including Cicada,
Extra-Deluxe-Supreme, Box of Breath, and Bonfire. Their music is both timeless
and surprising—raw, soulful, and joyfully unbound by genre.

address.streetAddress: Windmills Craftworks, Raheja Commerzone, Knowledge City, Rai Durg, Hyderabad - 500032Hyderabad

name: Windmills Music Night - Hazmat Modine - Good Friend Tour - Hyd

performer.description: Rattling with the sounds of migration from the caldron of New York City, Hazmat Modine returns to Europe rejuvenated, just in time for spring. They will be serving u the bones of American music on a platter of silver, brass, reeds, electric guitars, violin, and vocal harmonies, and as always, presided over by the dashing harmonica wizard Wade Schuman. Hazmat will be presenting music from their much-anticipated magnum opus, ostensibly entitled Extra-Deluxe-Supreme. The songs present allegories of triumph and tragedy. Musically, the inspiration is drawn from Memphis and Rock Steady- garnished with the sounds of Egyptian Afro-Pop, American roots and Tuvan Soul. Set to simmer, it's blended and distilled into a distinctive Hazmatian stew.
performer.name: Hazmat Modine

description:

name: Windmills Music Night - Hazmat Modine - Good Friend Tour

performer.description: Hazmat Modine is a New York City–based band led by singer, songwriter, and multi-instrumentalist Wade Schuman, known for turning roots music into something wildly original and impossible to categorize. Drawing from blues at its core, their sound expands into folk, jazz, and global traditions, powered by an uncommon lineup that can include harmonica, tuba, trumpet, saxophone, trombone, drums, banjo, guitar, and violin—all woven together with rich vocal harmonies.
performer.name: Hazmat Modine

description:
Their self-titled debut album was released at the 2019 Mahindra Blues
Festival, where they shared the stage with legends like Charlie Musselwhite,
Beth Hart, and Sugaray Rayford. They returned to the festival in 2023, opening
the show and jamming with icons such as Christone “Kingfish” Ingram, Taj
Mahal, and Buddy Guy. With growing acclaim from audiences and artists alike,
the Arinjoy Trio has become one of India’s most sought-after blues bands.

address.streetAddress: Windmills Craftworks, Raheja Commerzone, Knowledge City, Rai Durg, Hyderabad - 500032Hyderabad

name: Windmills Music Night - The Arinjoy Trio Live! - Hyd

performer.description: Formed in 2015, The Arinjoy Trio is one of the most exciting blues acts to emerge from the Indian music scene. Led by acclaimed guitarist and vocalist Arinjoy Sarkar, the trio also features Sounak Roy on drums and Aakash Ganguly on bass. Known for their high-energy live performances, the trio brings together a wide range of blues styles—from Chicago blues and blues rock to R&B—delivered with authenticity and passion.
performer.name: Arinjoy Trio

description:
Following the loss of their iconic vocalist Mangey Khan, the group begins a
new chapter with Bhura Khan—nephew of Lakha Khan—alongside dholak maestro
Magada Khan and multi-instrumentalist Sawai Khan. With spirit, innovation, and
pride, Barmer Boys continue to reimagine folk with attitude, carrying the
Manganiyar legacy to global stages.

address.streetAddress: Windmills Craftworks, Raheja Commerzone, Knowledge City, Rai Durg, Hyderabad - 500032Hyderabad

name: Windmills Music Night - Barmer Boys - Hyd

performer.description: Barmer Boys are the torchbearers of Rajasthan’s Manganiyar musical tradition, bringing ancient folk and Sufi sounds into the 21st century. Known for their soulful kalaams, Krishna bhajans, celebratory wedding songs, and electrifying jams with beatboxing, the trio has performed over 250 concerts across 25 countries, with appearances at Roskilde, WOMAD, FMM Sines, and NH7 Weekender.
performer.name: Barmer Boys
